tour.step1: Start by entering the full URL of the website or API endpoint you want to test.
tour.step2: Choose which test suites to run. You can run a load test, a Lighthouse audit, an AI-powered SEO check, or all of them at once!
tour.step3: If you're running a load test, select a pre-configured profile or create your own custom one.
tour.step4: Once you're ready, click here to start the test execution.

form.title: New Test Run
form.description: Configure and launch a new performance test run.
form.urlDescription: The full URL of the website or API endpoint to test.
form.testSuitesDescription: Select the types of tests you want to perform on the target URL.
form.k6SwitchDescription: Simulate traffic to measure backend performance.
form.seoSwitchDescription: Check on-page SEO factors with AI recommendations.

error.atLeastOne: You must select at least one test suite to run.

form.requestConfigDescription: Define the HTTP request for the k6 load test.
form.loadProfileDescription: Configure the intensity and duration of the load test.
form.customProfileDescription: Fine-tune the virtual users (VUs), duration, and ramping stages.
form.stagesDescription: Define how virtual users ramp up and down over time.

toast.historyClearedDescription: Your previous test history has been cleared.
toast.testStartedDescription: Your tests are now running. See status below.

clearHistoryDialog.title: Clear Previous History?
clearHistoryDialog.description: Starting a new test can clear your previous test history from this browser. Do you want to clear it before running this test?

running.title: Test Running...
running.description: Please wait while the tests are being executed. This may take several minutes depending on the configuration.

summary.title: Test Run Complete
summary.noK6Data: No k6 load test data available for this run.
summary.noLighthouseData: No Lighthouse audit data available for this run.
summary.noSeoData: No SEO analysis data available for this run.

history.title: Test History
history.description: Review, re-run, or load results from past test runs.
history.noHistoryDescription: Run a new test to see its results here.

toast.exportSuccessDescription: Your test history has been saved as a JSON file.
toast.importSuccessDescription: Your test history has been successfully loaded.
toast.importFailDescription: Could not import the history file.
toast.importInvalidFormat: The selected file is not a valid history file.
toast.deleteSuccessDescription: The test run has been removed from history.
toast.clearSuccessDescription: All test runs have been deleted.

clearAllDialog.title: Are you absolutely sure?
clearAllDialog.description: This will permanently delete all test history and recent URLs. This action cannot be undone.

deleteDialog.title: Delete Test Run?
deleteDialog.description: This will permanently delete this test run from your history. This action cannot be undone.

about.title: A Unified Command Center for Web Performance
about.description: K6 Commander is a local-first, containerized application that brings powerful load testing, Lighthouse audits, and AI-powered SEO analysis into a single, cohesive interface. No cloud accounts, no data sharing—just powerful tools running on your machine.
about.localFirstDescription: Your test configurations and results are yours. They are stored in your browser's local storage and never sent to a remote server. You are in full control.
about.unifiedToolingDescription: Stop juggling different tools. Run k6 load tests, Lighthouse audits, and SEO checks from one place. Get a single, comprehensive report for a holistic view of your site's health.
about.k6FeatureDescription: Simulate realistic traffic to find performance bottlenecks before they hit production.
about.k6HowItWorks: When you run a load test, the app spawns a dedicated k6 Docker container. Your configuration (URL, method, virtual users, stages) is passed securely as environment variables.
about.k6HowItWorks2: k6 sends metrics in real-time to a local InfluxDB container, which you can visualize live in a pre-configured Grafana dashboard. At the end, a JSON summary is saved for the final report.
about.lighthouseFeatureDescription: Audit your pages for performance, accessibility, best practices, and SEO.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks: The backend runs the official Google Lighthouse CLI using `npx` in a sandboxed process. It audits the provided URL directly, generating a detailed JSON and HTML report.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks2: The scores and core metrics are extracted from the JSON output and displayed in the summary view, while the full HTML report is saved for you to inspect every detail.
about.seoFeatureDescription: Go beyond standard checks with AI-driven on-page SEO analysis.
about.seoHowItWorks: The backend fetches the raw HTML of your URL and sends it to a Genkit AI Flow. The AI model is prompted to act as an expert SEO analyst.
about.seoHowItWorks2: It checks for crucial elements like title tags, meta descriptions, and canonicals, providing not just a pass/fail status but also actionable, AI-generated recommendations for improvement.
about.stackDescription: Built with modern, powerful, and open-source technologies.
about.involvedDescription: This is an open-source project. Contributions, bug reports, and feature requests are always welcome.

apiTester.newCollectionDescription: Create a new collection to organize your API requests.

deleteCollectionDialog.title: Delete Collection?
deleteCollectionDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete the '{{name}}' collection and all of its requests? This action cannot be undone.

deleteRequestDialog.title: Delete Request?
deleteRequestDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this request from your history? This action cannot be undone.

apiTester.noRequestsDescription: Your sent requests will appear here.

toast.cannotDeleteDefault: The default 'Scratch Pad' collection cannot be deleted.
toast.jsonFormatErrorDescription: The text in the body is not valid JSON.

apiTester.noResponseYetDesc: Send a request to see the response here.
